applications.name: Microsoft Outlook
applications.description: Microsoft Outlook is an email and personal information management application for managing email, calendar, contacts, tasks, and notes in personal and business environments.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and 1 together to switch to the Mail inbox view.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Mail view activated and read inbox folder name and message count.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and 2 together to switch to the Calendar view.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Calendar view and current date or selected appointment.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and 3 together to switch to the Contacts view.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Contacts view and number of contacts or selected contact.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and 4 together to switch to the Tasks view.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Tasks view and task list or selected task.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and 5 together to switch to the Notes view.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Notes view and note list.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and I together to navigate directly to the Inbox folder.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Inbox folder and number of unread messages.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and O together to navigate to the Outbox folder.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Outbox folder and number of messages waiting to send.

shortcuts.description: Press F6 to cycle forward through the Outlook panes: folder pane, message list, reading pane, and To-Do bar.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce each pane name as focus moves. Essential for efficient navigation.

shortcuts.description: Press Shift and F6 together to cycle backward through Outlook panes.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce previous pane name as focus moves backward.

shortcuts.action: Move between folder pane and message list
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Tab together to move focus between folder pane and message list.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce whether focus is in folder list or message list.

shortcuts.action: Collapse or expand group in list
shortcuts.context: When focus is on a group header
shortcuts.description: Press Left Arrow to collapse a group or Right Arrow to expand a group in message list or folder pane.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce group collapsed or expanded and group name.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and N together to create a new email message.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce new message window and place focus in the To field.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Enter together to send the current email message.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce message sent. Message window closes and focus returns to inbox.

shortcuts.context: When message is selected or open
shortcuts.description: Press Control and R together to reply to the sender of the selected message.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce reply window opened with sender in To field and focus in message body.

shortcuts.context: When message is selected or open
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and R together to reply to all recipients of the selected message.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce reply all window with all recipients in To and CC fields.

shortcuts.context: When message is selected or open
shortcuts.description: Press Control and F together to forward the selected message to other recipients.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce forward window opened with focus in To field and original message included.

shortcuts.context: When composing a message with recipients
shortcuts.description: Press Control and K together to check and resolve recipient names against address book.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce if names are resolved or if multiple matches require selection.

shortcuts.description: Press F7 to start spell checking the current message.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce spelling dialog with misspelled word and suggestions.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and A together to open file browser for attaching files to email.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce file picker dialog. Navigate files with arrow keys and press Enter to attach.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt and B together to display the BCC (blind carbon copy) field in the message header.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce BCC field displayed and may move focus to it.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt and C together to display the CC (carbon copy) field in the message header.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce CC field displayed.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt and F together to display the From field for selecting which email account to send from.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce From field displayed. Useful when managing multiple accounts.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and S together to save the current message as a draft.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce message saved to Drafts folder.

shortcuts.context: When message is selected in list
shortcuts.description: Press Control and O together to open the selected message in a new window.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce message window opened and read message header information.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Q together to mark the selected message or messages as read.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce message marked as read. Visual indicator changes.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and U together to mark the selected message or messages as unread.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce message marked as unread.

shortcuts.description: Press Delete to move the selected message to the Deleted Items folder.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce message deleted and move focus to next message in list.

shortcuts.description: Press Shift and Delete together to permanently delete the message without moving to Deleted Items.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may prompt for confirmation. Message is permanently removed.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and V together to open dialog for moving selected message to a different folder.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Move Items dialog. Type folder name or navigate with arrow keys.

shortcuts.description: Press Insert to flag the selected message for follow-up.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce message flagged. Opens flag options dialog if held.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and J together to mark the selected message as junk and move to Junk Email folder.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce message moved to Junk Email folder.

shortcuts.context: When reading a message with blocked images
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and I together to download and display blocked images in the current message.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce images downloading or displayed.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Less Than together to move to the previous message while keeping window open.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce previous message header and content.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Greater Than together to move to the next message while keeping window open.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce next message header and content.

shortcuts.description: Press Left Arrow to collapse or Right Arrow to expand a conversation in the message list.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce conversation expanded or collapsed and number of messages in thread.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and a number from 1 to 9 to execute the corresponding Quick Step action.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Quick Step executed. Quick Steps are customizable automated actions.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and E together to place focus in the search box for finding emails, contacts, or calendar items.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce search box active. Type search terms and press Enter to search.
